verses.verse: Concerning the collection of money, the collection for the sacred people, even as I specifically arranged with the assemblies of Galatia, so must you also do.
On each Day 1 after a Sabbath, each of you must put beside himself (as he saves) whatever he is successful in, so that no collections of money happen at the time when I come.
When I show up, whomever you approve, I will send these people through letters to carry off your generosity into Jerusalem.
If it is deserving of the "for me to also be traveling" kind, they will travel together with me.
I will come to you whenever I might go through Macedonia. You see, I am going through Macedonia,
but to you after that is obtained. I will stay with you, or even spend the storm season, so that you might bring me on my way to wherever I travel.
You see, I don't want to see you now while passing by; for I anticipate to stay over for some time close to you if the Master gives permission.
But I will stay over in Ephesus until the Fiftieth Day Festival.
You see, a door has opened to me, huge and active, and many are lying in opposition.
If Timothy comes, see to it that he might become fearlessly toward you. You see, he works on the work of the Master, as I also do.
So no one should treat him as a nobody, but bring him on his way in peace so that he might come to me. You see, I am waiting for him with the brothers.

Concerning Apollos, the brother, many times I encouraged him that he should come to you with the brothers, and by all means it was not what he wanted, that he would go now, but he will come when he has a good time to come.
Stay awake, stand in the trust, be a man, gain power.
Everything from you must happen in love.
I encourage you, brothers, (you realize the house of Stephanas, that it is a first-part-offering of Achaia, and they assigned themselves to a task of serving the sacred people)
that you also may be placed under these types of people and under everyone working together and laboring.
I am happy based on the arrival of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus because these people filled up your deficiency.
You see, they relaxed my spirit and yours. So you must recognize these types of people.
The assemblies of Western Turkey say hello to you. Aquila and Priscilla together with the assembly throughout their house say hello many times to you in the Master.
All the brothers say hello to you. Say hello to each other with a sacred friendly gesture.
The greeting (with my hand) of Paul.
If anyone is not fond of the Master Jesus, the Anointed King, he must be doomed. Maranatha (Aramaic for "the Master is coming").
May the generosity of the Master Jesus, the Anointed King, be with you.
My love is with all of you in the Anointed King Jesus. Amen. [This first letter was written to Corinth from Philippi and sent through Stephanas, Fortunatus, Achaicus, and Timothy.]
